result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew D. Westlund was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew D. Westlund in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Andrew D. Westlund in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:38 AM Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

State has filed an amended information.
Defendant will plead to both charges.

Address of Defendant is verified.

Atty Renc has received a copy of the amended information, waives reading and is prepared to enter pleas.

There is a plea agreement. Defendant will plead to Counts 1 and 2. Victim has been given notification.
State has complied with victim notification statutes. 

Atty Renc concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1 
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 2

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Renc for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Misdemeanor Theft
Count 2: Misdemeanor Theft

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 8 Months
Concurrent to any sentence the Defendant is currently serving
Huber granted for puposes of work or any other reason the Sheriff will allow
May serve second half of the last four months on electronic program if Defendant qualifies
96 Days Credit
Pay Court Costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
60 Days to pay or set up payment plan

Count 2:
Jail sentence for 8 Months, concurrent to Count 1
Concurrent to any sentence the Defendant is currently serving
Huber granted for puposes of work or any other reason the Sheriff will allow
May serve second half of the last four months on electronic program if Defendant qualifies
96 Days Credit
Pay Court Costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
60 Days to pay or set up payment plan
Pre-trial conference on May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew D. Westlund in court with attorney Anne Renc. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:25 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

M. Ford is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Molepske. 
Witness identifies the defendant. 
Cross exam by Atty Renc.

Officer A. Hopfensperger is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Molepske. 
Witness identifies the defendant. 

Atty Molepske makes closing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes closing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
$10,000 cash bond: No contact with Mack Ford or Angela Sodke or their residences occupied by them.

Attorney Anne Renc (special appearance) in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Andrew D. Westlund appeared by video. 
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
State requests $25,000 cash bond: No contact with Mack Ford or Angela Sodke or their residences occupied by them.
BTC: $10,000 cash bond: No contact with Mack Ford or Angela Sodke or their residences occupied by them.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
